reviews.review: I made an account just to review this movie. It is fan.tastic.

Outstanding movie... Emotional rollercoaster. The only thing I'm annoyed with is Chris Evans announcing he's leaving the MCU. Which basicly gives away one of the biggest deaths in Avengers 4!! Should have made the announcement next year!

Great film with 2+ hours of edge of your seat fun!  InfinityWar had a perfect blend of comedy and action throughout the run time.  And although this was a much darker and more gritty movie within the MCU, it wasn't overwhelming in the slightest.  Great job by the Russo brothers once again.  Absolutely can't wait to see where the MCU goes from here.
Movie was amazingly played out, Thanos is such a twisted and evil villain it really helps tie the movie together! 10/10 for me!

Best marvel movie ever made, solid on every level. And most impressive is how it paced itself and gave adequate character development for everyone The mix of humor was perfect (not overdone) and also quite cleverly written dialogue It’s no dark knight trilogy yet but for marvel it’s the best they have done...ever
Best movie I have seen in a while. Amazing!! Better then Star Wars and im a star wars fan boy. Awesome Movie!
More of the same. Extremely predictable. Very very slow to develop and the ending is very underwhelming.

I was not ready for this! This movie took on a whole new level than the previous ones. Although we had a few usual and humorous moments, the dark side of the Marvel Universe really took over. I was moved to see the team being broken in the worst possible way.
This was an exceptional movie. It combined the marvel universe and left me speechless.

This movie is not the culmination of years of setup. It is the *start* of the culmination. Understanding that will help temper expectations that are sure to be higher than anything that can ever be reached. 

There is a trope known as "continuity lockout," and it refers to newcomers not being able to understand the character or story if they arrive late in the game. With 10 years and 18 interconnected movies in this lore, continuity lockout is necessary for the story to continue. 

This movie is about plot. All of the characterizations of the players have been established in the previous movies, and this movie does not give any more development. The heroes that we know are at the service of the story, and their motivations are all the same: stop Thanos. 

This is Thanos's story (and consequently, Gamora's). It's his quest that we are intrigued by, and thank goodness that he is an interesting character to watch. He's a terrible individual, but his strength, cunning, and depth of emotion make him the most dangerous villain seen in the MCU. 

While the heroes are limited in the development of their characters, that does not mean that they are uninteresting to watch. The reason for that is because of the masterful establishment of their characters over previous installments by the producers and actors. At no point did I feel anything but genuine honesty coming from these characters and actors. 

Infinity War is done. Now comes the long wait for the next installment of The Avengers, an installment that for the first time, I can honestly say that I have no idea what will happen.
